XML Input File======================Configuration-------------We need to provide some data in `<configuration> </configuration>` in order to get a proper output file.First of all we need to provide information about output file - size of a frame,  Storage Aspect Ratio and framerate.		<frame>			<size>				<width>640</width>				<height>360</height>				<sar>1.0</sar>			</size>			<rate>				30			</rate>		</frame>then we setup codecs, like this:		<codecs>			<video>				<key>libx264</key>				<!--key>flv1</key-->			</video>			<audio>				<key>libmp3lame</key>				<!--key>libvo_aacenc</key-->			</audio>		</codecs>		<subtitles>../data/subtitles.srt</subtitles>finally we can also add soft subtitles, by providing path to the file with subtitles.Sequence and shots------------------After configuration we need to provide a content for our output file. In VideoGen we can merge multipile videos, music files, add some boards and images. We call it a sequence of shots. Each shot in sequence represents the video, image, music file or combination of this elements.Video shot----------One of the most basic examples of how to add video shot can be found below:		<shot>			<video>				<load type="AudioVideoFile">					../data/sintel_trailer-1080p.mp4				</load>		</shot>sometimes we want to use just a short fragment of a video, we can do so by using effect:		<effect type="VideoRange">			<unit>s</unit>			<from>10</from>			<to>20</to>		</effect>there are available three units:	-s second	-m minutes	-m:s minutes and sceondsby using video effects we can also repeat video:		<effect type="VideoRepeat">			<times>2</times>			</effect>Adding audio to our shot-------------------------Basic audio shot:		<audio>			<load type="AudioFile">				../data/dirty_fingernails.mp3			</load>		</audio>as in Video shot we can specify just a small part of our audio file:		<effect type="AudioRange">			<unit>m</unit>			<from>1</from>			<to>2</to>		</effect>there are available three units:	-s second	-m minutes	-m:s minutes and sceondsby using audio effects we can also repeat our audio file:		<effect type="AudioRepeat">			<times>3</times>			</effect>Generating silece-----------------		<audio>			<generate type="SilenceGenerate">				<unit>s</unit>				<duration>10</duration>			</generate>		</audio>there are available three units:	-s second	-m minutes	-m:s minutes and sceondsAdding images to shots----------------------In order to add image to shot we need to specify path to our image file.		<image>			<load type="ImageFile">				../data/cc.jpg			</load>		</image>Boards------Inside an <image></image> using VideoGen we can prepare more complecated visual effects using board feature.		<board>			<configuration>				<size>					<width>640</width>					<height>360</height>				</size>				<background>									<color>#4444DD</color>				</background>			</configuration>		...We need to specify our board's size and background color, then we can add some content.Adding text on the board------------------------			<text>				<id>ijo</id>				<content>jojo</content>				<color>#00FFFF</color>				<font>pilfonts/helvO24.pil</font>				<point>					<x>40</x>					<y>200</y>				</point>			</text>Adding pictures on the board----------------------------			<picture>				<id>mijo</id>				<align_id>ijo</align_id>				<filename>					../data/cc.jpg				</filename>				<point>					<x>40</x>					<y>30</y>				</point>				<size>					<x>200</x>					<y>101</y>				</size>				<transparent>					0				</transparent>			</picture>Adding rectangles on the board------------------------------			<rectangle>				<id>rec</id>				<align_id>mijo</align_id>				<point_start>					<x>200</x>					<y>101</y>				</point_start>				<point_end>					<x>240</x>					<y>141</y>				</point_end>				<color>#FF0000</color>			</rectangle>Adding elipse-------------			<ellipse>				<id>elp</id>				<align_id>rec</align_id>				<align>					<x>center</x>					<y>center</y>				</align>				<point_start>					<x>0</x>					<y>0</y>				</point_start>				<point_end>					<x>40</x>					<y>40</y>				</point_end>				<color>#FFFF00</color>			</ellipse>Adding lines------------			<line>				<id>line</id>				<align_id>rec</align_id>				<point_start>					<x>0</x>					<y>-100</y>				</point_start>				<point_end>					<x>40</x>					<y>0</y>				</point_end>				<width>4</width>				<color>#FF00FF</color>			</line>Example input file------------------Below is an example of XML input file:<videogen>	<configuration>		<frame>			<size>				<width>640</width>				<height>360</height>				<sar>1.0</sar>			</size>			<rate>				30			</rate>		</frame>		<codecs>			<video>				<key>libx264</key>				<!--key>flv1</key-->			</video>			<audio>				<key>libmp3lame</key>				<!--key>libvo_aacenc</key-->			</audio>		</codecs>	</configuration>	<sequence>		<shot>			<video>				<load type="AudioVideoFile">					../data/sintel_trailer-1080p.mp4				</load>				<effect type="VideoRange">					<unit>s</unit>					<from>10</from>					<to>20</to>				</effect>				<effect type="VideoRepeat">					<times>2</times>				</effect>			</video>		</shot>		<shot>			<image>				<board>					<configuration>						<size>							<width>640</width>							<height>360</height>						</size>						<background>							<color>#444444</color>						</background>					</configuration>					<text>						<content>ijo ijo!</content>						<color>#00FFFF</color>						<point>							<x>40</x>							<y>200</y>						</point>					</text>					<picture>						<filename>							../data/cc.jpg						</filename>						<point>							<x>40</x>							<y>300</y>						</point>						<size>							<x>200</x>							<y>101</y>						</size>						<transparent>							0						</transparent>					</picture>				</board>			</image>			<audio>				<generate type="SilenceGenerate">					<unit>s</unit>					<duration>10</duration>				</generate>			</audio>		</shot>	</sequence></videogen>
